com.flurry.android.ads

Class FlurryAdTargeting

  • java.lang.Object
    • AdTargeting
      • com.flurry.android.ads.FlurryAdTargeting

  • public final class FlurryAdTargeting
extends AdTargeting
    Targeting settings for ads. Targeting allows partners to supply information they track internally, which is not available to Flurry's targeting system. If the targeting settings are matched on the ad server, a subset of targeted ads will be delivered to the user.
    See Also:
    Flurry Publisher Support Site

      • setUserCookies

        public void setUserCookies(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> userCookies)
        Set the user cookies. User cookies allow the developer to specify information on a user executing an ad action. The user cookies are transmitted to the Flurry servers on each ad click. The user cookie key/value pairs will be transmitted back to the developer via the app callback if one is set.
        Parameters:
        userCookies - A Map<String,String> of key/value pairs that will be transmitted to the Flurry servers when the ad is clicked.
        See Also:
        clearUserCookies()

      • clearUserCookies

        public void clearUserCookies()
        Clear the user cookies.

      • setKeywords

        @Deprecated
public void setKeywords(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> targetingKeywords)
        Deprecated. 
        Set the keywords. Keywords allow the developer to specify information on a user executing an ad action for the purposes of targeting. The keywords are transmitted to the Flurry servers on each ad request.
        Parameters:
        targetingKeywords - A Map<String,String> of key/value pairs to send to the Flurry servers when an ad is requested.
        See Also:
        clearKeywords()

      • clearKeywords

        @Deprecated
public void clearKeywords()
        Deprecated. 
        Clear the keywords.

      • setEnableTestAds

        public void setEnableTestAds(boolean enabled)
        Set enable test ads. Call to receive test ads from the Flurry server to ensure proper implementation. Test ads do not generate revenue and therefore MUST be disabled before app submission.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable test ads, false to disable.
